summary: This is a July 23, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It transmits a confidential production of materials related to individuals the government does not currently intend to call as witnesses at trial, governed by a protective order. The letter also notes the government's intent to call a witness named 'Ma' at trial.

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces confidential materials related to individuals it does not currently intend to call as witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, governing the confidentiality of materials like those produced in this letter.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office is producing confidential materials related to potential witnesses it does not currently intend to call at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial.
The production is governed by a July 31, 2020 Protective Order, and materials are marked 'SUBJECT TO PROTECTIVE ORDER' to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The government reserves the right to call any of the individuals listed in the attached index as witnesses at trial.

The government provides notice that it now intends to call a witness referred to as 'Ma' at trial, and will not produce additional materials regarding 'Ma' until the standard witness disclosure schedule.
The letter is addressed to five defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
